### 1.2 An alternative that minimizes harm done on prior knowledge

Let $N = {x_1, x_2 ... x_n}$ be the set of samples the network was trained on, with the set of distinct labels $Y_N$. Then we define the harm done on prior knowledge based on new image $ z $ as:

$$ \mathbb E_{c \in Y_N} [ \Delta e_c \mid z, N] $$

Given a neural network,  $f: \mathcal X \to \mathbb R ^ m$, where the output is a score for every one of the $m$ classes, we define the cross entropy loss as: 

$$e_c (\theta') = \frac{1}{|N_c |} 
\biggr( 
\sum_{j \in N_c} \log \biggr( \frac{\exp(f(x_j ; \theta'))_c)}
{\sum_k \exp(f(x_j; \theta')_k)} \biggr)
\biggr)$$

Where:
$N_c = \{ x_i \in N \mid y_i = c \}$
$c \in \mathbb R$

Simplifying the expression for $\Delta e$, with $\theta' = \theta - \eta \nabla_\theta \mathcal l(f(z ; \theta)) $ (i.e. $\theta'$ is $\theta$ after one gradient step prompted by new sample $z$):

$$\Delta e_c = e_c(\theta') - e_c(\theta) \\
= \frac{1}{|N_c |} 
\biggr( 
\sum_{x \in N_c} \biggr( \log \biggr( \frac{\exp(f(x ; \theta'))_c)}
{\sum_k \exp(f(x; \theta')_k)} \biggr) 
- \log \biggr( \frac{\exp(f(x ; \theta))_c)}
{\sum_k \exp(f(x; \theta)_k)} \biggr) \biggr )
\biggr) \\
= \frac{1}{|N_c |} \sum_{x \in N_c} \log 
\frac {\exp(f(x; \theta')_c) \sum_k \exp(f(x;\theta)_k)} 
{\exp(f(x; \theta)_c) \sum_k \exp(f(x; \theta')_k)}$$
